ON THE CUSP.Definition: at the point when something is about to happen

RICHES.Definition: large amount of money and possessions

CONTEMPLATE.Definition: think about something for a long time

MORTALITY.Definition: the fact that people don't live forever

PROTAGONIST.Definition: the main character of a story

SIDE EFFECT.Definition: an unpleasant effect of a medical treatment

OBSESSED.Definition: unable to stop thinking about something

LIFE EXPECTANCY.Definition: the length of time a human being is likely to live

LIFESPAN.Definition: the length for which someone exists

MODIFY.Definition: change something in order to make it better

REPLACEMENTS.Definition: the processes of putting one thing in the place of another

IMMORTALISTS.Definition: people who support the idea that, with the help of science, people can live forever

REVERSE.Definition: change the result of something to its opposite

LUMP.Definition: a piece of a substance or material

ENTREPRENEUR.Definition: someone who starts a new business

IMPLANTABLE.Definition: designed to be connected to a person's body

INTERFACES.Definition: connections between a person and a computer

TRANSPLANTING.Definition: moving something from one place to another

PRESENCE.Definition: the state of existing or being present

HEART BYPASS.Definition: a surgical operation in which an alternative blood channel is created to improve blood flow

REPLACEMENT.Definition: the process of putting one thing in the place of another

DRAW THE LINE.Definition: set a limit on what we accept

CONTENTED.Definition: accepted as something that is enough

AT FIRST GLANCE.Definition: when considered for the first time

IRONICALLY.Definition: in a strange way because of being very different from what someone would expect

SUPPLEMENTS.Definition: substances added to complete a diet

FASTING.Definition: avoid eating for a long period

ANOMALIES.Definition: things that are different from what is standard and expected

ATTRIBUTED.Definition: regarded something as resulting from a specific cause
